title: ANCIIENTS Announces First US Tour In Eight Years
description: Happening this September and October. The post ANCIIENTS Announces First US Tour In Eight Years appeared first on Metal Injection.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 7 hours ago
text: Anciients – fresh off releasing their first new record in six years Beyond the Reach of the Sun in 2014 – is coming back to the United States for the first time in eight years this September! The tour features Dawn Of Ouroboros, Armed For Apocalypse, Exist and Nott as openers and kicks off on September 27 at Substation in Seattle, WA. Get your tickets here. "It's been a long time coming, which makes it that much more special to announce that we will finally be returning to the USA for a run of shows this summer/fall," said Anciients vocalist Kenny Cook. "We've got a handful of killer bands joining us on select dates, to get us to and from the ProgPower fest in Atlanta. We look forward seeing our American fans out on the road!" 8/27 Seattle, WA Substation (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros & Nott)8/28 Portland, OR Dante’s (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros & Nott)8/29 Boise, ID The Shredder (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros)8/30 Salt Lake City, UT Aces High Saloon (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros)8/31 Colorado Springs, CO What’s Left Records (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros)9/2 Oklahoma City, OK 89th Street (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros)9/4 Atlanta, GA ProgPower USA9/5 Gastonia, NC The Rooster (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros & Exist)9/6 New Orleans, LA No Dice (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros & Exist)9/7 Austin, TX Come And Take It (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros & Exist)9/8 Houston, TX Pub 529 (w/ Armed For Apocalypse & Exist)9/9 Dallas, TX TX Tea Room (w/ Armed For Apocalypse & Exist)9/11 Phoenix, AZ Nile Underground (w/ Armed For Apocalypse)9/12 San Diego, CA Brick By Brick (w/ Armed For Apocalypse)9/13 Los Angeles, CA Knucklehead (w/ Armed For Apocalypse)9/14 San Francisco, CA Thee Parkside (w/ Armed For Apocalypse)9/16 Sacramento, CA Cafe Colonel (w/ Armed For Apocalypse)9/17 Reno, NV The Cellar (w/ Armed For Apocalypse)9/18 Eugene, OR John Henry’s (w/ Armed For Apocalypse & Nott)9/19 Richland, WA Ray’s Golden Lion (w/ Armed For Apocalypse & Nott)9/20 Bellingham, WA The Shakedown (w/ Armed For Apocalypse & Nott) Want More Metal? html:
Anciients – fresh off releasing their first new record in six years Beyond the Reach of the Sun in 2014 – is coming back to the United States for the first time in eight years this September! The tour features Dawn Of Ouroboros, Armed For Apocalypse, Exist and Nott as openers and kicks off on September 27 at Substation in Seattle, WA. Get your tickets here.

"It's been a long time coming, which makes it that much more special to announce that we will finally be returning to the USA for a run of shows this summer/fall," said Anciients vocalist Kenny Cook. "We've got a handful of killer bands joining us on select dates, to get us to and from the ProgPower fest in Atlanta. We look forward seeing our American fans out on the road!"

8/27 Seattle, WA Substation (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros & Nott)
8/28 Portland, OR Dante’s (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros & Nott)
8/29 Boise, ID The Shredder (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros)
8/30 Salt Lake City, UT Aces High Saloon (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros)
8/31 Colorado Springs, CO What’s Left Records (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros)
9/2 Oklahoma City, OK 89th Street (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros)
9/4 Atlanta, GA ProgPower USA
9/5 Gastonia, NC The Rooster (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros & Exist)
9/6 New Orleans, LA No Dice (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros & Exist)
9/7 Austin, TX Come And Take It (w/ Dawn Of Ouroboros & Exist)
9/8 Houston, TX Pub 529 (w/ Armed For Apocalypse & Exist)
9/9 Dallas, TX TX Tea Room (w/ Armed For Apocalypse & Exist)
9/11 Phoenix, AZ Nile Underground (w/ Armed For Apocalypse)

9/13 Los Angeles, CA Knucklehead (w/ Armed For Apocalypse)

9/16 Sacramento, CA Cafe Colonel (w/ Armed For Apocalypse)
9/17 Reno, NV The Cellar (w/ Armed For Apocalypse)
9/18 Eugene, OR John Henry’s (w/ Armed For Apocalypse & Nott)
9/19 Richland, WA Ray’s Golden Lion (w/ Armed For Apocalypse & Nott)
9/20 Bellingham, WA The Shakedown (w/ Armed For Apocalypse & Nott)
